title: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

title: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

title: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
author: Washington Irving

title: Some days are just bad days, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that's just the way it is!
author: Dita Von Teese

title: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
author: Christopher Morley

title: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
author: Arthur Koestler

title: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves, but it's there if you look deep.
author: Taraji P. Henson

title: To have felt too much is to end in feeling nothing.
author: Dorothy Thompson

title: First, accept sadness. Realize that without losing, winning isn't so great.
author: Alyssa Milano

title: Every life has a measure of sorrow, and sometimes this is what awakens us.
author: Steven Tyler

title: Crying is cleansing. There's a reason for tears, happiness or sadness.
author: Dionne Warwick

title: Good humor is the health of the soul, sadness is its poison.
author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

title: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.
author: John Steinbeck

title: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.
author: Leo Buscaglia

title: It doesn't hurt to feel sad from time to time.
author: Willie Nelson

title: We look before and after, And pine for what is not; Our sincerest laughter With some pain is fraught; Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

title: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
author: Rollo May

title: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

title: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

title: The sad truth is that opportunity doesn't knock twice.
author: Gloria Estefan

title: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.
author: Kevin Bacon

title: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
author: Rumi

title: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.
author: Norman Cousins

title: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
author: Franz Schubert

title: Dying is only one thing to be sad over... Living unhappily is something else.
author: Morrie Schwartz

title: I do believe that if you haven't learnt about sadness, you cannot appreciate happiness.
author: Nana Mouskouri

title: Delicious tears! The heart's own dew.
author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

title: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

title: Oh, I am very weary, Though tears no longer flow; My eyes are tired of weeping, My heart is sick of woe.
author: Anne Bronte

title: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.
author: Henry David Thoreau

title: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
author: Jim Rohn

title: The word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
author: Carl Jung

title: There is no despair so absolute as that which comes with the first moments of our first great sorrow, when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and be healed, to have despaired and have recovered hope.
author: George Eliot

title: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.
author: Hannah Arendt

title: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.
author: Saadi

title: It's a sad man my friend who's livin' in his own skin and can't stand the company.
author: Bruce Springsteen

title: Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.
author: H. G. Wells

title: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative, and by being creative, you can get beyond your pain or negativity.
author: Yoko Ono

title: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
author: William Cowper

title: Sadness is also a kind of defence.
author: Ivo Andric

title: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
author: Jean Racine

title: I had sadness for breakfast.
author: Andy Milonakis

title: If you don't know about pain and trouble, you're in sad shape. They make you appreciate life.
author: Evel Knievel

title: Sad will be the day for any man when he becomes contented with the thoughts he is thinking and the deeds he is doing - where there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger; which he knows he was meant and made to do.
author: Phillips Brooks

title: Sorrows are like thunderclouds, in the distance they look black, over our heads scarcely gray.
author: Jean Paul

title: If we could read the secret history of our enemies we should find in each man's life sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

title: Red is the ultimate cure for sadness.
author: Bill Blass

title: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

title: Sad things happen. They do. But we don't need to live sad forever.
author: Mattie Stepanek

title: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

title: In this world, full often, our joys are only the tender shadows which our sorrows cast.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

title: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart, don't know how to laugh either.
author: Golda Meir

title: Above all things let us never forget that mankind constitutes one great brotherhood; all born to encounter suffering and sorrow, and therefore bound to sympathize with each other.
author: Albert Pike

title: Do not make best friends with a melancholy sad soul. They always are heavily loaded, and you must bear half.
author: Francois Fenelon

title: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.
author: Jackie Kennedy

title: Actually, the moment of victory is wonderful, but also sad. It means that your trip is ended.
author: Bill Toomey

title: We're taught to be ashamed of confusion, anger, fear and sadness, and to me they're of equal value to happiness, excitement and inspiration.
author: Alanis Morissette

title: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.
author: William Wordsworth

title: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
author: Joseph Campbell

title: Your joys and sorrows. You can never tell them. You cheapen the inside of yourself if you do tell them.
author: Greta Garbo

title: My parents' divorce left me with a lot of sadness and pain and acting, and especially humour, was my way of dealing with all that.
author: Jennifer Aniston

title: We never taste happiness in perfection, our most fortunate successes are mixed with sadness.
author: Pierre Corneille

title: Tears are nature's lotion for the eyes. The eyes see better for being washed by them.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

title: In deep sadness there is no place for sentimentality.
author: William S. Burroughs

title: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
author: Sophocles

title: When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
author: Khalil Gibran

title: I love my past, I love my present. I am not ashamed of what I have had, and I am not sad because I no longer have it.
author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

title: People are sad. People are broke. People are worried about money, people are worried that they're not enough and not amounting to anything and they don't feel good about themselves. People have rough times, and everybody's pretending it's not true, and we need to break that veneer.
author: Eve Ensler

title: They say it's better to bury your sadness in a graveyard or garden that waits for the spring to wake from its sleep and burst into green.
author: Conor Oberst

title: I've cried, and you'd think I'd be better for it, but the sadness just sleeps, and it stays in my spine the rest of my life.
author: Conor Oberst

title: Everything's complicated, even those things that seem flat in their bleakness or sadness.
author: Nick Hornby

title: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy.
author: Eudora Welty

title: You left and I cried tears of blood. My sorrow grows. Its not just that You left. But when You left my eyes went with You. Now, how will I cry?
author: Rumi

title: Why does the rest of the world put up with the hypocrisy, the need to put a happy face on sorrow, the need to keep on keeping on?... I don't know the answer, I know only that I can't.
author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

title: We never taste a perfect joy; our happiest successes are mixed with sadness.
author: Pierre Corneille

title: I can see the humorous side of things and enjoy the fun when it comes; but look where I will, there seems to me always more sadness than joy in life.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

title: Isn't it sad to go to your grave without ever wondering why you were born? Who, with such a thought, would not spring from bed, eager to resume discovering the world and rejoicing to be part of it?
author: Richard Dawkins

title: It is a sad thing when men have neither the wit to speak well nor the judgment to hold their tongues.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

title: My father's death, my move, and my frightening and difficult delivery created a tremendous amount of stress, pain, and sadness for me. I was practically devastated beyond recovery.
author: Brooke Shields

title: You get used to sadness, growing up in the mountains, I guess.
author: Loretta Lynn

title: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
author: Mark Twain

title: Melancholy and sadness are the start of doubt... doubt is the beginning of despair; despair is the cruel beginning of the differing degrees of wickedness.
author: Comte de Lautreamont

title: Sad people dislike the happy, and the happy the sad; the quick thinking the sedate, and the careless the busy and industrious.
author: Horace

title: Live by this credo: have a little laugh at life and look around you for happiness instead of sadness. Laughter has always brought me out of unhappy situations.
author: Red Skelton

title: When I seemed to be irritable or sad, my father would quote the learned Dr. Knight, and then say, 'Just go to sleep.' Like all smart aleck kids, I thought the advice was silly. But as I've grown older, I've realized just how smart Knight was.
author: Ben Stein

title: When sparrows build and the leaves break forth, My old sorrow wakes and cries.
author: Jean Ingelow

title: You have to let it all hang out, let go of the ideas that were more comfortable and embrace some of the sadness in your life.
author: Madeleine Peyroux

title: We tell our triumphs to the crowds, but our own hearts are the sole confidants of our sorrows.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

title: Sadness is a super important thing not to be ashamed about but to include in our lives. One of the bigger problems with sadness or depression is there's so much shame around it. If you have it you're a failure. You are felt as being very unattractive.
author: Mike Mills

title: I seldom think about my limitations, and they never make me sad. Perhaps there is just a touch of yearning at times; but it is vague, like a breeze among flowers.
author: Helen Keller

title: I get mad. I get sad. I have all those emotions. But I just like to keep them to myself. I don't think my fans need to be bothered with if I'm mad or sad about something. I should just be concerned that they are keeping up with my music or I'm making them happy with my show.
author: Demi Lovato

title: Words are less needful to sorrow than to joy.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

title: It's a source of great sadness to me that my father died without having seen me do anything worthwhile. He was constantly having to make excuses for me.
author: Daniel Day-Lewis

title: The saddest thing that befalls a soul is when it loses faith in God and woman.
author: Alexander Smith

title: And I remember going to the record studio and there was a park across the street and I'd see all the children playing and I would cry because it would make me sad that I would have to work instead.
author: Michael Jackson

title: Tears are the natural penalties of pleasure. It is a law that we should pay for all that we enjoy.
author: William Gilmore Simms

title: It is one of the most saddening things in life that, try as we may, we can never be certain of making people happy, whereas we can almost always be certain of making them unhappy.
author: Thomas Huxley

title: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
author: William Blake

title: Let us remember that sorrow alone is the creator of great things.
author: Ernest Renan

title: He who is not just is severe, he who is not wise is sad.
author: Voltaire

title: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

title: The reason for the sadness of this modern age and the men who live in it is that it looks for the truth in everything and finds it.
author: Edmond de Goncourt

title: The display of grief makes more demands than grief itself. How few men are sad in their own company.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

title: If my world were to cave in tomorrow, I would look back on all the pleasures, excitements and worthwhilenesses I have been lucky enough to have had. Not the sadness, not my miscarriages or my father leaving home, but the joy of everything else. It will have been enough.
author: Audrey Hepburn

title: One should either be sad or joyful. Contentment is a warm sty for eaters and sleepers.
author: Eugene O'Neill

title: The old know what they want; the young are sad and bewildered.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

title: I was raised in an atmosphere of 'everything's fine.' But as I got older, I was like, 'Well no, everything's not fine. There is stuff that's sad.' I am a really sensitive person. I think I am too sensitive sometimes.
author: Ellen DeGeneres

title: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

title: At the end of the day, I'm a person. I have feelings. I get tired. I get sad.
author: Summer Walker
tags: Tired, Day, End Of The Day

title: When you wake up each morning, you can choose to be happy or choose to be sad. Unless some terrible catastrophe has occurred the night before, it is pretty much up to you. Tomorrow morning, when the sun shines through your window, choose to make it a happy day.
author: Lynda Resnick

title: I work a lot in the slums of Tondo, Manila, and the life there is poor and very sad. And I've always taught to myself to look for the beauty of it and look in the beauty of the faces of the children and to be grateful.
author: Catriona Gray

title: It's time to say goodbye, but I think goodbyes are sad and I'd much rather say hello. Hello to a new adventure.
author: Ernie Harwell

title: It's sad when someone you know becomes someone you knew.
author: Henry Rollins

title: I don't know how the poor farmers deal with such situations in real life. It's really sad.
author: Sanjay Dutt

title: You can never control who you fall in love with, even when you're in the most sad, confused time of your life. You don't fall in love with people because they're fun. It just happens.
author: Kirsten Dunst

title: When you feel sad, it's okay. It's not the end of the world. Everyone has those days when you doubt yourself, and when you feel like everything you do sucks, but then there's those days when you feel like Superman. It's just the balance of the world. I just write to feel better.
author: Mac Miller

title: When people ask me, 'Are you happy?' I respond with, 'You've asked the wrong question.' There is a deep kind of satisfaction you get from building a company. This kind of satisfaction transcends happy, sad, hard, or easy. I seek satisfaction. I want to be positively disruptive.
author: David Ulevitch

title: Never make a decision when you are upset, sad, jealous or in love.
author: Mario Teguh

title: It's sad to know I'm done. But looking back, I've got a lot of great memories.
author: Bonnie Blair

title: It is sad not to love, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

title: I don't like people around me sad. I like making people happy.
author: Tyler, The Creator

title: I am convinced that material things can contribute a lot to making one's life pleasant, but, basically, if you do not have very good friends and relatives who matter to you, life will be really empty and sad and material things cease to be important.
author: David Rockefeller

title: Hear me, my chiefs! I am tired. My heart is sick and sad. From where the sun now stands, I will fight no more forever.
author: Chief Joseph

title: I am closest to my mother, as she is my rock, my pillar of strength, and my world. Not only has she stood by me through all times - happy, sad, and otherwise - but there have even been moments when I had completely lost hope, and her immense belief in me had lifted me up.
author: Amruta Khanvilkar

title: We can feel sad, hurt, demoralized. But we can't give up.
author: Patrisse Cullors

title: Better by far you should forget and smile that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina Rossetti

title: There's no excuse to be bored. Sad, yes. Angry, yes. Depressed, yes. Crazy, yes. But there's no excuse for boredom, ever.
author: Viggo Mortensen

title: Grief is never something you get over. You don't wake up one morning and say, 'I've conquered that; now I'm moving on.' It's something that walks beside you every day. And if you can learn how to manage it and honour the person that you miss, you can take something that is incredibly sad and have some form of positivity.
author: Terri Irwin

title: I like happy endings in movies. I think life has a happy ending. When it's all said and done, it's all something worthwhile, and I want my movies to reflect that. There are enough things to be sad about. When you pop in a movie, let the message be one that's one of hope.
author: Jon Favreau

title: For me, singing sad songs often has a way of healing a situation. It gets the hurt out in the open into the light, out of the darkness.
author: Reba McEntire

title: I think social media has taken over for our generation. It's a big part of our lives, and it's kind of sad.
author: Kendall Jenner

title: The influence of social media is unbelievable. It's sad to see - it's a fake life that some people live.
author: Virgil van Dijk

title: Everybody has their favorite sad songs. That's part of what I love so much about country music. Country music is never afraid to go with a sad song.
author: Chris Young

title: There are times I am happy. There are times I am sad. But I always try to separate emotion from the need to reach for something stronger, deeper. And then no matter the emotion, I can reach for a stability that helps me accomplish what is the goal.
author: Troy Polamalu
tags: Always, I Am Happy, I Am

title: People who have never dealt with depression think it's just being sad or being in a bad mood. That's not what depression is for me; it's falling into a state of grayness and numbness.
author: Dan Reynolds

title: Life has to be everything. It can't be all sad. It can't be all peaches and cream. Because the lows have you appreciate the highs. And the highs give you perspective on the lows. If it's not everything, it becomes flat or mundane.
author: Sterling K. Brown

title: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
author: Brigitte Bardot

title: All people are sad clowns. That's the key to comedy - and it's a buffer against reality.
author: Bob Odenkirk

title: I think people just think I am crazy because they see me doing stand-up, but I am generally not. I am very sad. I'm one of those guys that lights candles and listens to Rachmaninoff.
author: Bobby Lee

title: Nothing always stays the same. You don't stay happy forever. You don't stay sad forever.
author: Cat Zingano

title: I was sad and in a dark place, and I turned to a hobby to sort of take me out of that.
author: Cole Sprouse

title: The sad duty of politics is to establish justice in a sinful world.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

title: 'Spring Day' - I wrote main lyrics based on my personal experience with old friends. It is about my sad memories with him, and it makes me sentimental whenever I listen to the song.
author: Suga

title: I know what I look like - a weird, sad clown puppet. I'm fine with that.
author: Rainn Wilson

title: We tell them that we believe it will be beautiful because that is our specialty, we only create joy and beauty. We have never done a sad work. Through the drawings, we hope a majority will be able to visualize it.
author: Christo

title: When you're happy you don't always have to be laughing, and when you're sad you don't have to be crying; sometimes it's the opposite. You laugh when you're the most upset.
author: Freddie Highmore

title: I've discovered if you have a small circle of people you know you can rely on - in good times, bad times, happy times, sad times - who aren't going to judge you and will, sometimes, just sit and listen to you without saying anything, then I think you're very fortunate.
author: Shirley Ballas

title: I think Paris smells not just sweet but melancholy and curious, sometimes sad but always enticing and seductive. She's a city for the all senses, for artists and writers and musicians and dreamers, for fantasies, for long walks and wine and lovers and, yes, for mysteries.
author: M. J. Rose

title: But it's a journey and the sad thing is you only learn from experience, so as much as someone can tell you things, you have to go out there and make your own mistakes in order to learn.
author: Emma Watson

title: The day I am not able to fly will be a sad day for me.
author: Ratan Tata

title: It's sad when girls think they don't have anything going on except being pretty.
author: Keri Russell

title: It's hard to watch your life unfold, and sad. Life changes.
author: Cilla Black

title: Football is now all about money. There are problems with the values within the game. This is sad because football is the most beautiful game. We can play it in the street. We can play it everywhere.
author: Johan Cruyff

title: Football is a sad game.
author: George Best

title: I was always spiritual, even as a child. I was taught to pray, show gratitude. We had an attitude of gratitude. Even if life was ugly, bad or sad - we prayed.
author: Shilpa Shetty

title: There's a rule of writing: if everything is funny, nothing is funny; if everything is sad, nothing is sad. You want that contrast.
author: J. Michael Straczynski

title: The monarchy is foremost a business, and it's important to them that the British public continue to finance the excessive luxurious lifestyles of the now quite enormous, wasteful and useless 'royal' family. I find it very sad.
author: Morrissey

title: When one's dead, one's dead... This squirrel will become earth all in his time. And still later on, there'll grow new trees from him, with new squirrels skipping about in them. Do you think that's so very sad?
author: Tove Jansson

title: I had often sought for the peace there is in Christ, but I could not seem to find the freedom I desired. A terrible sadness rested on my heart. I could not think of anything I had done to cause me to feel sad; but it seemed to me that I was not good enough to enter Heaven, that such a thing would be altogether too much for me to expect.
author: Ellen G. White

title: I like to play the grey areas in life - that's the most uncomfortable place to be. Nobody likes to be in that in-between state where there don't know what's going to happen. There's a lot of tension in that, and a lot of stuff to play with - where it's uncomfortable and awkward and sad and scary.
author: Melanie Lynskey

title: Novi Sad is a really beautiful city, and the club is really nice. It is one of the best youth academies in Serbia.
author: Dusan Tadic

title: I was given this beautiful coffee table book of Soviet architecture for my birthday. It has a lot of holiday camps, swimming pools, theatres, and buildings that were built for leisure activities. Incredible architecture in the most obscure places. It's a little bit sad, because a lot of it has been left to fall apart.
author: Roisin Murphy

title: There is no such thing as death. In nature nothing dies. From each sad remnant of decay, some forms of life arise so shall his life be taken away before he knoweth that he hath it.
author: Charles Mackay

title: As a gay man, there are certain places that I avoid. When I go to China, I lie and pretend I'm not married, which is really sad - I leave my ring at home. But I'm not willing to risk my safety in a country that could cause me no end of problems or where it's illegal to be gay. I'm very aware of the places I can travel to safely and where I cannot.
author: Tan France

title: I'm not Meryl Streep. My God - she's the greatest actor that ever lived. It's sad that ordinary actors like me are compared to her.
author: Sissy Spacek

title: I never made it to the school choir because the music teacher didn't like my voice. I was pretty sad. But he was probably right; I did have a voice a bit like a goat, but my dad told me to never give up and to keep going, and it's paid off.
author: Shakira

title: I comment on my friends' things; whatever they post, I post funny posts. I don't post anything that's too sad or mad, or at least not for too long. And I'm usually just a happy person! Silly - people would describe me as silly and crazy and fun.
author: GloZell

title: Today, actors aren't forced to ditch their regional accents like they used to. The best example's Tom Baker, a Scouser who went to great lengths to change his accent and ended up with something alien - and fantastic. It's sad that when the likes of him go, there won't be those sorts of accents any more.
author: Matt Berry

title: The good times of today, are the sad thoughts of tomorrow.
author: Bob Marley

title: The sad truth is that the civil rights movement cannot be reborn until we identify the causes of black suffering, some of them self-inflicted. Why can't black leaders organize rallies around responsible sexuality, birth within marriage, parents reading to their children and students staying in school and doing homework?
author: Henry Louis Gates

title: So many gods, so many creeds, so many paths that wind and wind while just the art of being kind is all the sad world needs.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

title: I love jazz music and sad music. I'm a sentimental guy. I'm a romantic guy.
author: Fred Durst

title: I've always been pretty independent, no matter what situation: good, bad, ugly, happy, sad. I dig deep, and I get over it.
author: Mel B

title: You may not enjoy loneliness, because loneliness is sad. But solitude is something else; solitude is what you look forward to when you want to be alone, when you want to be with yourself. So, solitude is something we all need from time to time.
author: Ruskin Bond

title: Usually when people are sad, they don't do anything. They just cry over their condition. But when they get angry, they bring about a change.
author: James Russell Lowell

title: You can't have an up without a down, a right without a left, a back without a front - or a happy without a sad.
author: Harlan Coben

title: I have a complicated relationship with the zoo; maybe everyone does. It's so wonderful and so sad.
author: Victoria Coren Mitchell

title: What makes old age so sad is not that our joys but our hopes cease.
author: Jean Paul

title: It's not about being happy 100 percent all the time, cause that's just life. I make sad songs, too, that really only make the happy songs better.
author: Kyle

title: I write a lot of sad songs!
author: Lauv

title: We have but one permanent home: heaven - that's still the old truth that we always have to re-learn - and it's only through the impact of sad experiences that we assimilate it.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

title: How sad it is that we give up on people who are just like us.
author: Fred Rogers

title: I've written about this before, but the sad truth is this: There are only a handful of Trump true believers in the Senate. The rest are chugging a toxic slurry of cowardice, ambition, and opportunism that has led members of the upper house of a co-equal branch of government to relinquish their power and prerogatives.
author: Rick Wilson

title: Many scientists think that philosophy has no place, so for me it's a sad time because the role of reflection, contemplation, meditation, self inquiry, insight, intuition, imagination, creativity, free will, is in a way not given any importance, which is the domain of philosophers.
author: Deepak Chopra

title: I had no interest in music. But now, music means everything to me. I have no words to explain how beautiful music is. It is where you can create everything, like beautiful songs to sad songs to almost anything.
author: Alan Walker

title: Until the age of five, my parents spoke to me in Chinese or a combination of Chinese and English, but they didn't force me to speak Mandarin. They serve as threats and metaphors, but they allow the story to be about people.
author: Jonathan Maberry

title: The world would be a very sad place if readers could only love one story.
author: Sylvia Day

title: You know, why at the end of your life should you assemble thousands of pages of 'Why am I so sad, why am I so depressed?' Instead, assemble thousands of pages of why you're so content.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

title: It's not like I force myself to think of sad things, but... it's more that I make music because it makes me happy.
author: Jamie xx

title: The sad truth is that excellence makes people nervous.
author: Shana Alexander

title: I talked to ex-wives of musicians of the '70s for research. They're the funniest people in the world, yet there is this sad, beautiful thing in their eyes that says they've seen more than they could ever possibly tell you.
author: Kate Hudson

title: I only really watch sport. That's where you see real joy. I don't like watching much else on TV, because it's generally either twisted or sad.
author: Roger Milla

title: For creators, especially for me as a composer, I am sure for singers also, it is sad. It is not exciting that we have to create something that someone else has already done before.
author: Amit Trivedi

title: The sad fact is that it would be fair to say that United is a generic, bureaucratic, tired company. A sort of DMV in the sky. No real culture. No real strategy. No real expectations for employees or customers. All of which is a shame.
author: Patrick Lencioni

title: My childhood, I would say, was a bit sad.
author: Columba Bush

title: In the '50s, too many women, even though they were very smart, they tried to make the man feel that he was brainier. It was a sad thing.
author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

title: We all suffer in our own way; like, life is miserable. And I'm not, 'Oh, I'm a stand-up who's sad,' but the reality is that just about everyone is quietly unhappy. I don't think that pertains to comedians specifically. I think most people look at themselves in the mirror and are not happy with what they see.
author: Nick Kroll

title: You are validating someone's life by telling their story. Even if it's a sad one.
author: Alex Tizon

title: Tony Benn and I were very close, very close friends for 30, 40 years. We talked to each other a great deal, and we were great friends. And I was with him shortly before he died, talking about prospects of the world and prospects for peace. And I'm very sad that he's gone.
author: Jeremy Corbyn

title: I'm sad to see the passing of the great drug warriors. I certainly did my part in that battle and I don't regret any of it.
author: Marc Maron

title: I am essentially optimistic. Being alive is incredible. Life is extraordinary and beautiful. It can be hard and sad and terrifying, but it's all we've got.
author: James Frey
